statement.tex: %text You want to build a tiled walking track of fixed width around a rectangular park. But you can only afford $3100$ tiles of $1$ sq. foot each. How wide can you make your track if the park is $160(ft)\times 140(ft)$? %

step.context: %text If the width of the walking track is ${\bf w}$ and the park is $160(ft)\times 140(ft)$, what is the area occupied by the track? %
step.reason: %text To establish the area occupied by the track, subtract the area of the park from the total area of the rectangle which includes both park and track. % \begin{align} A&={\small\left[(160+w)\times (140+w)\right]-(160\times 140)(ft^2)} \\ &={\small 160\times 140+160w+140w+w^2-160\times 140} \\ &=w^2+300w=w(w+300) \end{align}

step.context: %text If total track affordable area $(w^2+300w)$ is $3100(ft^2)$, what is track width ${\bf w}$? %
